security: Redaction of Social Security Numbers (SSN) due to unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.
summary: This document is a notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponed release of certain information, specifically Social Security numbers, from HSCA staff payroll records, along with supporting documentation related to Elizabeth K. Selleck's employment and a worker's compensation claim.
summary_one_paragraph: This document consists of a Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board, dated December 8, 1995, concerning the postponement of certain information within HSCA staff payroll records, specifically Social Security numbers, to prevent an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. It also contains supporting documentation related to Elizabeth K. Selleck, including her employment records with the House of Representatives' Select Committee on Assassinations, a worker's compensation claim filed in 1978, a leave record, and payroll authorization forms, outlining her appointment and termination dates, salary, and a memo regarding payroll certifications for relationships to members of Congress.
title: Final Determination Notification
recipient: Clerk of the House of Representatives
